text: welcome to daily video vocabulary a dose
of daily new English phrases and words
brought to you by let's talk podcast
calm
Pirlo English learners welcome to daily
video vocabulary episode 71 in today's
episode I have a new word for you
lethargic let's find out what it means
and how you can use it in your daily
conversation lethargic sometimes you
feel very tired and dull you just don't
feel like doing anything the word
lethargic basically means to lack
enthusiasm due to laziness or to be low
on energy
and feel totally dull when you are
lethargic you feel as if all your energy
has been drained out you are not willing
to do anything and wish to just lie down
or sleep you are unresponsive and
inactive to things around you you feel
very tired and exhausted and are not
interested in anything so one who is
lethargic is lacking mental and physical
alertness many medicines have side
effects of making you feel lethargic
that means they make you feel very
sluggish and lazy and you actually feel
very weak
as the word lethargic describes the
state of being lazy and dull it is an
adjective
okay now that you know what lethargic
means let's take a look at some example
sentences to see how you can use it in
your daily conversation example 1 the
turtles become sluggish and lethargic
when their body temperature drops in the
winter season example 2 the star player
had to be pulled out from the team
because he seems to be lethargic for the
important game example 3 people who
smoke are generally lethargic as smoking
starves the tissues and brain for oxygen
leaving them feel dull and disoriented
example for Maria refuses to take any
medicine for her cold because any
medication makes her feel drowsy and
lethargic example 5 due to her
depression Lisa was lethargic and failed
to complete her household chores the
entire day she simply lazed on the couch
example 6 after waking up from the
surgery the patient felt very weak and
lethargic because of the anesthesia
example seven after the late night party
the next day Peter was so lethargic that
he didn't go to work and lied on the
sofa the whole day example 8 James
avoided having a heavy meal before his
presentation as he didn't want to feel
lethargic while presenting at the
conference example 9 Smith was fired
from his job due to his continuous
lethargic approach and inefficiency at
work
example 10 Richard was so lethargic even
after a good sleep that he went to see
the doctor to find out what was wrong
that's the end of today's episode do you
feel lethargic very often and how do you
deal with it kindly share your
experiences in the comment box below
this video thank you for watching us
do watch all the episodes of daily video
vocabulary to better your English
language skills do subscribe to our
Channel and stay updated with all the

till then
bye and take care
